title: Dolce & Gabbana to Stop Using Fur in Its Designs in 2022, Testing ‘Eco-Fur’
sub_head: Gucci, Prada have instituted similar bans; Louis Vuitton sells a $25,900 mink logo hoodie
body:
Fur is increasingly falling out of favor at luxury fashion houses.
On Monday, Dolce & Gabbana, the Milan-based fashion house, said it was discontinuing the use of fur in its products this year. Moncler SpA, the Italian outerwear brand known for its slick puffer coats, similarly stated last week that it was cutting fur from its line.
